prompts.text: Would {best_self_description} choose to scroll right now?

Visualize {best_self_description}. What would they choose now, and why?

Write a quick reminder to your future selfâ€”the one who's achieved {goal_1}â€”about why this choice matters.
Take one slow breath. Feel the air entering and leaving your nose.
Notice your feet on the floor. Feel the weight and contact.
Unclench your jaw and breathe out slowly.
Look away from the screen. Focus on something 10 feet away for five seconds.
Notice one sound around you. Listen closely for five seconds.
Take two deep breathsâ€”slow and steady.
Bring one hand to your chest and feel one full breath.
Feel your phone in your hand. Notice its texture and weight.
Count three breaths in silence.
Notice your shoulders. Let them drop naturally.
Let your eyes rest. Blink slowly twice.
Feel the ground under you. Take a slow breath.
Take three slow breaths. On each exhale, release tension from your body.
Close your eyes. Notice one thing you can smell, one you can hear, one you can feel.
Straighten your posture and breathe deeply five times.
Do a mini body scan: forehead, shoulders, chest, stomach, legs.
Count ten breaths silently. Focus on the pause between inhales and exhales.
Focus on your breath at the tip of your nose for 30 seconds.
Bring attention to your posture and take five mindful breaths.
Follow the guided breathing: In 4, Hold 4, Out 6â€”repeat for one minute.
Close your eyes for one minute and focus only on the sensation of breathing.
Do a slow, 60-second body scan from head to toe, noticing sensations.
Listen for the sounds around you. Notice each sound come and go for one minute.
Spend one minute focusing on your breath. Each time your mind wanders, bring it back gently.
